What is Boston Weather like?.Answers: On a day to day basis Boston weather is a changing variable. It is early spring here which means temperatures will be in the 60-40F range. While it may be comfortable during the day you should carry a coat for the evenings. It also does rain here a fair amount so a waterproof jacket and umbrella is recommended. The snow should be over... should be...

How do I get around?.Answers: Pro tip - from the airport! Take the Silver line bus from Logan for free to South Station. Up the escalator and out to Atlantic Street you will find cabs at the curb and no waiting in line for them.

There are many options for getting into the city from the airport. Look for the $5 shuttle to the Back Bay. Even cheaper rides on the MBTA Blue line might work for you. There is taxi service and door to door shuttles. The MBTA is by far the best option as it is inexpensive and runs quite often - that is either a shuttle that will take you to the Airport Blue line subway stop or the Siver Line1 bus which goes to the heart of downtown, South Station, the main train and bus hub for Boston. Lyft and Uber are also allowed to drop-off and pickup from the airport.

The best option for getting around the city itself is the MBTA. The closest subway stop is Back Bay Station which is located on the Orange Line. The second best option is the Bus system. The 43 Bus will take you downtown as will the SL4 and SL5.
There are Hubway (bike sharing) stations dotted throughout and both Lyft and Uber work quite well here.
Try Safr, redefining ridesharing for women, launched March 1 to kick off Women's History Month
Unfortunately parking will be limited in this area. There is metered street parking and pay parking garages in the area but they will be pricey for all day parking but is available.

Boston Common and Public Garden. See the Swan Boats.

Lunch was awesome but I'm still hungry o.Answers: Fortunately you are located right in the South End which has many options for food in the Boston area. Alongside some of Boston's finest restaurants are many boutique shops as well as supermarkets which should have everything you need. There are other areas close by such as the Theatre District and Chinatown with many more restaurants to hit every price range.
